resources.string: "You have been using Psychea for 20 days! We encourage you to participate in the mental health survey."
Released from Theory is a platform for students and high school students to create their own social projects.

As part of the project "Psychea - 20 Days to a Healthy Mind," we are creating an innovative Android application dedicated to anyone interested in improving their mental health. Our application focuses on various aspects of mental health, offering a comprehensive set of tools.
Krzysztof Rataj - Social Media Specialist, Designer, Main Text Content Editor

Painting, drawing, playing a musical instrument, or creating something from paper or clay provides an opportunity for self-expression and relaxation. Creative activities positively affect the psyche by reducing tension and stress.

Regular reading of books, especially those positive and motivating, develops imagination, allows one to detach from daily worries, and brings relaxation. Reading also beneficially affects concentration and eloquence.
Walks, trips to the park, or outings into nature help to destress and disconnect from urban hustle and bustle. Contact with nature allows for relaxation, improves mood, and reduces negative thoughts.

Regular meditation practice helps reduce stress, improve concentration, and increase a sense of calmness. It involves focusing attention on the breath and calming the mind, leading to improved mental well-being. You can start with a few minutes a day and gradually increase the duration of meditation.

Engaging in regular physical exercise, such as jogging, cycling, or dancing, helps release endorphins - the hormones of happiness. This improves mood, reduces stress, and increases overall productivity.

Writing a daily journal is an excellent way to express emotions and reflect on past experiences. It helps in understanding one\'s feelings, solving difficulties, and focusing on the positive aspects of life.

Regular 7–9 hours of sleep per night and allocating time for rest are crucial for good mental health. It\'s worth planning time for relaxation, reading, listening to music, or conversations with loved ones to rejuvenate the mind and improve overall balance.

Establishing healthy social relationships with family, friends, or support groups can help cope with life\'s difficulties. Sharing problems and mutual assistance can significantly increase feelings of security and emotional satisfaction.
The balance between proper nutrition and psyche is crucial. Consuming healthy, nutritious meals rich in vitamins and minerals positively affects brain function, and thus, mental health.
Relaxation exercises, such as deep breathing, muscle stretching, and progressive relaxation, help relax the body and mind, reduce tension, increase concentration, and improve well-being.

Maintaining a balance between work and rest is crucial for a healthy psyche. Proper rest and leisure time allow for the regeneration of strength, stress reduction, and improvement in overall productivity and well-being.

Repeating positive affirmations, such as "I am strong" or "I am a valuable person," helps reinforce positive thinking and build self-confidence. This simple exercise helps strengthen mental health and build a positive approach to life.

Regular physical exercise has a beneficial impact on mental health. Exercise releases endorphins, chemicals in the brain that act as natural painkillers and stress relievers. It can also improve sleep and increase energy levels.
Nutrition plays a significant role in brain function. Consuming diverse, nutrient-rich meals supports mental health. Try to avoid excessive consumption of sugar, saturated fats, and processed foods.
Sleep plays a crucial role in physical and mental regeneration. Lack of adequate sleep can lead to mental health problems such as increased stress or decreased well-being.
Relaxation techniques such as meditation, deep breathing, or yoga can help reduce stress levels. Practicing these methods regularly can improve coping skills in difficult situations.
Maintaining healthy social relationships is crucial for good mental health. Sharing feelings with loved ones, conversations, and emotional support can help cope with life difficulties.
Finding time for hobbies and activities that bring joy can act as a natural way to relieve stress and improve mood. Hobbies are also an important element of self-development.
Setting boundaries between work and personal life helps maintain balance. Excessive involvement in work can lead to fatigue and mental health problems.
Depression is a mood disorder characterized by feelings of sadness, worthlessness, loss of interest in life and pleasure, as well as changes in mental and physical functioning.

Symptoms of depression may include sadness, loss of energy, difficulty concentrating, changes in appetite, insomnia or excessive sleepiness, feelings of worthlessness or excessive guilt, suicidal thoughts.

Anxiety disorders are a group of mental disorders characterized by excessive fear or worries that are disproportionate to real threats and can lead to significant suffering and limitations in daily functioning.
Examples: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD), social phobia, specific phobia, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD), post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
Personality disorders are patterns of behavior, emotions, and thinking that are enduring, ingrained, and lead to significant problems in social and occupational functioning.
Examples: Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD), Narcissistic Personality Disorder (NPD), Avoidant Personality Disorder (AvPD).
Bipolar affective disorders are a group of mental disorders characterized by periods of mania, during which there is excessive mood or energy, and periods of depression.

Symptoms: During mania, there may be excessive excitement, excessive self-esteem, rapid thinking, impulsiveness. During depression, there may be sadness, feelings of hopelessness, fatigue, decreased interest in life.
Psychotic disorders are a group of disorders characterized by a loss of contact with reality, which can manifest as hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking, and behavior.
Examples: Schizophrenia, Schizoaffective Disorder, Brief Reactive Psychotic Disorder.
Eating disorders are mental disorders that affect how a person consumes food, often leading to unhealthy eating behaviors and serious health consequences.
Examples: Anorexia Nervosa, Bulimia Nervosa, Binge Eating Disorder (BED).
Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) is a neurobiological disorder characterized by difficulties in concentration, excessive impulsivity, and hyperactivity.
Symptoms: Impaired attention span, impulsivity, excessive motor activity, difficulties in task organization and planning.
Sleep disorders are various disturbances that affect a person\'s ability to achieve satisfying and restorative sleep.
Examples: Insomnia, sleep apnea, circadian rhythm sleep-wake disorders.
Substance use disorders are a group of disorders resulting from the misuse or addiction to psychoactive substances such as alcohol, drugs, medications.
Examples: Alcoholism, drug addiction, prescription drug addiction.
Anxiety disorders are a group of mental disorders characterized by the presence of strong and chronic anxiety symptoms, which often lead to avoidance of anxiety-provoking situations.
Examples: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), panic disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

Most of the cognitive processes, emotions, and motivations occur beyond an individual\'s conscious perception. Unconscious processes can have a significant impact on our behavior and decisions, even if we are not aware of them.

Déjà vu is the feeling that we have experienced a particular situation or place before, although we cannot recall when or where it happened. Although scientists are not certain about its exact cause, it is believed that this phenomenon is related to a temporary disruption in perceptual processes.

People tend to conform to the behaviors and opinions of others in a group, even if it contradicts their own beliefs. This phenomenon, known as group pressure, can lead to making decisions that are not in line with one\'s own values and convictions.

The boomerang effect is a phenomenon in which persuading someone to change their views or behaviors may result in the opposite effect, i.e., reinforcing them in their original beliefs. This is an important phenomenon in the context of social communication and education.

The human brain has the ability to adapt and change, known as brain plasticity. This enables us, for example, to learn new skills, recover functions after brain injuries, and change our habits and beliefs. Brain plasticity allows us to continuously adapt to changing life circumstances and environments.
GREG GAMES Grzegorz Mikulski - Publisher of applications on Google Play platform
"Support phones - helpline is toll-free. Calling these numbers is the first thing we can do when our mental state deteriorates and we cannot go to a psychologist."
PSYCHEA - 20 days to a healthy mind
Free your mind! It\'s a kind of clicker. If you\'re stressed, start tapping the screen to release anger. It also helps when you need to focus but feel distracted.
"Your mental health is as important as your physical health." - Unknown
"Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible." - Francis of Assisi
"Positive thinking brings positive results." - Michael Josephson
"Strength does not come from never falling, but from rising every time we fall." - Confucius
"The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall." - Vince Lombardi
"The road to success is paved with failures, but they're the bricks that make the path worthwhile." - Unknown
"Daily efforts are the key to lasting success." - Unknown
"Your thoughts shape your life. If you want to change your life, you must first change your thoughts." - Unknown
"Even the longest journey begins with a single step." - Laozi
"Action is the antidote to fear, action is the antidote to uncertainty, action is the antidote to doubt." - Anthony Robbins
"Never give up on the things that make you smile." - Unknown
"Life is not a journey along a straight road, but a dance on hills and valleys." - Unknown
"If you're going through hell, keep going. Everything comes to an end." - Winston Churchill
"Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful." - Albert Schweitzer
"Sometimes the smallest step in the right direction ends up being the biggest step of your life." - Unknown
"Your limitations are only in your imagination." - Unknown
"Courage is not about never falling, but about rising every time we fall." - Confucius
"Rest is a misunderstanding for those who work." - John Lennon
"It's important to look to the future with optimism, but always remember the lessons of the past." - Unknown
"Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving." - Albert Einstein

Every day, we accumulate many worries and stress over various situations. Many of these worries are trivial, cluttering our minds unnecessarily. Enter what\'s bothering you or causing you stress, and then symbolically forget about it by clicking the button. Free your mind and focus on more important matters!
Every day you unlock a new quote. You can see the Quote of the Day on the main screen. All the quotes you\'ve already unlocked are available here. Keep using Psychea to unlock more quotes!
